I made a little Alfred workflow to search and paste emoji. Lots of the existing workflows either:

  • Haven’t added newer emoji like melting face which is very important ğŸ« 
  • Don’t support MacOS Monterey without installing PHP or python

ğŸ‘‰ Findmoji Alfred Workflow

items.content_text:
Couple of small updates to [Micromarks](https://micromarks.rknight.me/) this morning:

- "Remember Domain" on the login screen so you don't have to input your domain every time you want to login
- A favicon because I forgot to do one initially ğŸ™ƒ

items.content_html:
Having decided to move my read later needs to micro.blog, I realised the current UI doesn’t work quite how I want. Specifically hiding when deleting/unbookmarking and multi-delete, so I made a little web app to do exactly that.

ğŸ”– Micromarks
items.content_text:
Having decided to move my read later needs to micro.blog, I realised the current UI doesn't work quite how I want. Specifically hiding when deleting/unbookmarking and multi-delete, so I made a little web app to do exactly that.

ğŸ”– [Micromarks](https://micromarks.rknight.me)

items.content_html:
I’m slightly regretting my “use subdomains instead of buying separate domains for new projects” rule now I need to migrate a lot of those sites to a new server.

Also, obligitory moan about DNS because DNS.
items.content_text:
I'm slightly regretting my "use subdomains instead of buying separate domains for new projects" rule now I need to migrate a lot of those sites to a new server.

items.content_html: Thanks to @pratik’s help I have combined both shortcuts into one so it runs on both MacOS and iOS. Download the new combined shortcut here
items.content_text: Thanks to [@pratik](https://micro.blog/pratik)'s help I have combined both shortcuts into one so it runs on both MacOS and iOS. [Download the new combined shortcut here](https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/876d4c98272c4deb9f155a656a6929ec)

items.content_html: Thanks to @canion I now know I can use bookmarks here as my read later service (and finally ditch Pocket). I’ve put together a shortcut for MacOS and one for iOS to save links to Micro.blog bookmarks
items.content_text: Thanks to [@canion](https://micro.blog/canion) I now know I can use bookmarks here as my read later service (and finally ditch Pocket). I've put together a shortcut for MacOS and one for iOS to [save links to Micro.blog bookmarks](https://rknight.me/save-bookmark-to-micro-blog-shortcut/)
